availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Nicholas County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Mary Potts. Father of Thomas Potts and Emma Potts. Farmer in Nicholas County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in 1860.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nicholas County, District 1, p. 447. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nicholas County, Moorfield, District 1, p. 47. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Nicholas County, District 1, p. 4. Find A Grave, “William Ritchey Potts (April 25, 1828-May 18, 1883),” Memorial #20906041, http://findagrave.com/memorial/20906041 (accessed February 16, 2018).
